responses.text: When you're thinking about your customer segments, you need to be really specific. I tell clients to imagine they're writing a letter to one specific customer rather than to a vague group. This helps you speak directly to their needs and pain points.
responses.context: Discussion about marketing strategy for Fuji's business

responses.text: Your pricing isn't just about covering costs. It communicates your value. Think of it like the cover of a book - it's the first impression potential clients get about the quality inside. Premium pricing says premium experience.
Systems are like rivers. They should flow naturally with gravity doing most of the work. When you find yourself pushing against the current, that's a sign your system needs restructuring.
